result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam P. Naidl

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 2:39 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam P. Naidl in court. Attorney Ann Larson appearing with the defendant. Not guilty plea.  Jury calendar. Offer deadline: 07-22-22.

ADDRESS INFO for Adam P. Naidl
Current: 931 S. 23rd Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 06-15-2022)
Prior: W10237 Lake Emily Rd, Fox Lake, WI 53933
RE:  Possess drug paraphernalia as repeater, on 05-28-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess drug paraphernalia and possess illegally obtained prescription.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.    Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on PO hold.
Minutes.
